Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: MIboardr
Reviews.Content: If you've been researching hotels in Rome, you obviously know how expensive they are. I am quite budget concious, so given the lcoation I feel this is one of the best values in Rome. It is directly across from the forum and down the street from the colleseum. We literally walked all over rome from here: Trastavere, the Vatican, Spanish steps, Trevi fountain, and don't miss the small church which is only couple blocks away that is very unassuming... it houses the chains that held St.Peter and Michaelangelo's famous Moses sculputre. If you're not a walker, buy one of the tourist bus passes and hop on and off. Back to the hotel... It was clean, the room size was bigger than I expected, and the bed was mediocre. The breakfast is similar to other places: very standard european fair: crossaint and coffee. Through my research I found out you can see the forum from some rooms if you look out the window and to the left. I requested one of these rooms, but later regretted it. These rooms face a busy street, so there was much noise all night. At 3:00am there was an argument between 4 garbage men - it sounded like they were in my room. I popped my head out the window and yelled at them, but after simulateously pausing and looking in my direction they went back to their conversation (they obviously had no idea what "shut the f*#! up" means). The next day the hotel was very accomodating about moving me to a room on the backside. This room had a small balcony, but it was on an interior courtyard for a few other building and a restaurant (i.e. grungy view, but I didn't care). The next night we had piece and quiet! Overall the service was good and the room was clean. I would definitely recommend this to someone traveling to the area who wants to be centrally located. As a side note that has nothing to do with this hotel. My wife and I actually had a hard time finding good food in Rome - it is all tourist crap i.e. pizza & crappy pasta. For authentic Italian food at good prices go to the Trestavere neighborhood (sp?). It's not far and it's what they consider the working class neighborhood. Also, if you like indian food, go east on the main street in front of the hotel and there will be an indian restaurant about a block and half up on the left - it is the best Indian food I've had in my entire life!

Reviews.Title: “Small, friendly and nice.”
Reviews.Author: gkfld
Reviews.Content: This small, but very clean and suprisingly quiet place, was a pleasure to stay at. The rooms are very basic, but the location is perfect and the staff was very friendly and helpful. Pro: -clean -quiet -friendly & helpful staff -location close to Forum/Colosseum Con: -very basic breakfast -no internet

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel very close to colisseo and foro romano”
Reviews.Author: frambus
Reviews.Content: This is a small and nice hotel , wonderful ubication, 2 minutes away from the ancient Rome, and so from the Campidoglio, and the great Monument to Victor Emanuel, the hotel is very clean, it has air condition, and a smal flat screen t.v. Helpful and kind staff, breakfast "continental"(coffee, croissant, toasted bread,juice and conffiture) is served in a nice terrace just in front of the hotel, very pleasant. The individual room is very small, but I saw the doble rooms, and they are regular. I really like this hotel, the only problem is that if you get front room it will be very noisy, because there are some cafés, and gelaterias, and of course a grand avenue which is Via Cavour, this avenue takes you direct to TERMINI , the railroad train station, you can make it by walking, but is about 15 o 20 minutes and is up the hill.

Reviews.Title: “adorded it and recommend to everyone”
Reviews.Author: ranna16
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated close to the coliseum. The staff is friendly, the room is clean and hotel is cheap. Before the arrival the staff sent an email giving the instruction how to get there with the prices of each transport. Which was very helpful. Adored my stay there and recommended it to all.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough”
Reviews.Author: no1me
Reviews.Content: The best in this hotel is location. I've alredy stayed there twice as I like it. If you luky you will have view from the windows to the Fori Imperiali. Just 3 minutes walking and you are near the Coloseo,10 minuts and you are on via del Corso or via Vittorio Emanuele. The rooms are small but clean. Breakfast is poor. The hotel does have small elevator. I consider it as more or less good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Crego85
Reviews.Content: I love the hotel Romano. I have stayed there on two occasions. The location is superb, the bedrooms extremely clean, breakfast very nice in the sunshine. The staff are akk very friendly and helpful, most especially the wonderful Santo who is an ambassador for Rome!!!!! The hotel feels safe and is Largo Corrado Ricci, which has lots of little restaurants. From my bedroom I could see across to the Forum and the Typewriter building. I would advise anyone going to Rome to book into the Romano. Catherine in Dublin, Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, friendly staff, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: JMtl
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 1 night in early May - 3 adults in a triple. When you walk out of the hotel, take a left, and walk 50 meters - you'll see the Colosseum just up the street. The location was perfect. The people at reception are very friendly, and helped us whenever we needed anything. The rooms were basic, but very clean. I've travelled a lot, and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice.”
Reviews.Author: Paulomet
Reviews.Content: I stayed in three hotels during my stay in Rome recently and Romano was my favorite. For the price the location was excellent. The rooms were very clean and the staff friendly. I had a room on Cavour, a big street, but it was not noisy at all, airy in fact. The location is excellent; up the block from the Colloseo metro, on the corner of the Forum itself. Walking distance to pretty much everything. I will go back there when I bring my kids in a couple of years.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel Romano is great!”
Reviews.Author: Crego85
Reviews.Content: I thoroughly enjoyed my short stay in the Hotel Romano and hope to return sooner rather than later. The first person I met was the lovely gentleman, Santo, at reception who was so kind and welcoming, My room was spacious and overlooked a busy little street with lots of bars and restaurants. The bathroom was clean and had plenty of soft white towels. It could be a bit noisy, but once you pulled the shutters, even an afternoon siesta was possible. The Romano is in a wonderful location - right beside the Forum and the Colesseum and walking distance from all you want to see in Rome. In the morning you get a token to have breakfast from the little café next door. It was fine, though a man might need a slightly bigger breakfast. I heartily recommend the Romano and thought it wonderful value for money. My thanks to all there for making my stay so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Charmless and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: the4newmans
Reviews.Content: The only thing going for this hotel is its central location. Otherwise, this is a small and dark hotel, with cheerless and dark rooms that are more than a little worn at the edges. The staff are not friendly, and every interaction with the hotel, from booking to payment was made complicated. Given all of this, the prices charged make this a very poor value hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: IrishPol
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights here and I knew the price of this hotel when I booked it, but I did not realise just how little I got for my money. Room only, well almost.! as the included breakfast was very small indeed (packet of melba toast with butter & jam coffee, fruit juice and pastry) from the snack bar next door (it took less than 5 mins to consume). We were'nt offered Tea / Coffee on arrival as we had to wait until the room was cleaned (at 2.30pm) & there was'nt even facilities (for tea / coffee) in the room. There is no wireless internet, lounge, bar or resturant here and when we asked for a good place to dine we were pointed in the direction of the place next door. (tourist trap) There appears to have been street works going on right outside recently so the ground was a bit rough. The area is very touristy and can be noisy, but this hotel is within walking distance from every attraction within Rome (especially the Collosseum and Forum), Though we did take the bus to the Vatican. We did walk back that evening (and back to the Vatican the next day approx 40 min walk) every other attraction is no more than 30 min walk at the most. The room was clean though housekeeping did not change out towels throughout our three night stay. The staff were helpful and courtious towards us, but in the future I think I will be forking out the extra dough and moving up a couple of stars. There probably is better value accommodation in Rome and if I were going back I would look elsewhere before booking Hotel Romano again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: sunl0ver78
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Albergo Romano in May last year for 4 nights during our honeymoon. It's about a 7-10 min walk from Colloseum & metro station, and literally across the road from the Roman Forum. Santo the owner was very friendly. Our room was spacious, with a window facing the busy street, but it's very quiet if you keep the window closed. The room is reasonably clean, with a small but modern bathroom. The included continental breakfast was at a cafe next door -and consisted of a pack of dry bread/biscuit, a coffee, a juice and a muffin. It was defintely the worst breakfast we had during our trip to France & Italy. There were a few great restaurants next door where we ate many times. Overall, a decent hotel, fairly convenient and good value, but breakfast was a let down.

Reviews.Title: “2 night stay”
Reviews.Author: kolC
Reviews.Content: After a marvelous tour of the Colosseo and the Forum, we were eating at a cafe (next door to Romano) and marveling how nice it would be if we could eat here everyday. I nudged my hubby several times to go ask what the room tariff was for the glass door facing us...and while he was reluctant at the idea of moving I was too curious, not expecting it would actually be less than the Holiday Inn we were staying at REALLY FAR away.. Romano @ 70EUR and 60EUR (rooms 424 and 425) were cheaper than Holiday Inn and although the rooms were small, they were clean and cozy and less American. I stay at hotels all the time because I travel for work and really I was craving a Roman feel(although I love the Intercontinental Group for their decor and hospitality) People & Service: Santo, the man who greeted us in did not lose the niceties in translation. He was sweet, so was the second person in the afternoons (he was also very helpful, thanks to him we saw more than my Hubs would have agreed to walk otherwise) BUT....the last guy at the counter at night when we checked out 2 nights later was horrible...he should either learn some manners or look for another job. I would hate Romano to lose business because of a sulky soul like his. All in all it was value for money... as for me, waking up to face the chariots and to eat amazing cake for breakfast is a treat for me. I am sure there's way better food, location and service out there, but if you dont have a whole lot of money to spend like us, but do want something different and 'local' this is where I say you go. Things they could improve: 1. breakfast menu 2. Internet 3. the night-shift grumpy guy 4. hair-dryers

Reviews.Title: “I don't know why anyone would want to stay here. 2 star hotel - 4 star prices.”
Reviews.Author: elizadaynight
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located near the Colosseum - in my opinion, too close and the area is too touristy. The rooms are bare bones - clean and decent sized, but that is about it. The tv is tiny; there is no internet or wireless as advertised; there is no lock box as advertised; and there is no lounge or sitting area. And breakfast is served in the cafe next door where you are treated as a pest and are given their choice of pastry on a plastic plate (don't even think about asking for a particular one) along with a package of toast and some thick red juice in a plastic cup. If this hotel were cheap (at least under 80 Euro), then it might be a bargain, but it was double for us and that is a real joke. I would stay up further on Via Cavour or on one of the side streets like Via del Serpenti or Via del Broshetto - if you choose this area. When you ask the staff where to eat, they point to the tourist traps right in front of the hotel and have no idea of anything besides what is in the most obvious brochures.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION...BUT...”
Reviews.Author: ipswichjimlee
Reviews.Content: We arrived on thursday lunchtime & were given room 422 (fourth floor). The room was quite spacious, we had booked a double room but there was also a single bed in the room. The bed was quite comfortable & the room clean & bright, on the downside when we opened the window it was directly above the kitchen extractor of the restaurant next door, the smell was quite overpowering so we had to keep the windows closed. There was plenty of wardrobe/ drawer space to put our clothes in. Disappointingly there was no tea/coffee making facilities in the room & nowhere in the hotel that you could get a hot drink if you wanted it, also there was only one power point in the room. The bathroom was as you would expect, decent shower/ wc & it was cleaned daily. Breakfast was served in the cafe next door & was a typical continental breakfast pastry, packet toast, coffee, fruit juice, butter & jam all disappointingly served on plastic plates. One major fault was that on 3 of the 5 days we stayed here( friday, sunday & monday) the lift didn't work, when it did work it didn't sound like it was working right. When we spoke to the staff at reception about this, they would apologise & say it would be sorted but didn't seem to bothered about it. On the friday somebody got stuck in the lift, & although the alarm was ringing, the man at reception didn't do anything until we told him about it. Asyou can guess it was no fun going up& down 4 flights of stairs & elderly guests would really have struggled. The hotel has a fabulous location in the heart of rome with all attractions within walking distance, it's such a pity that for the want of a few basic facilities, this could be an excellent hotel. Would i use this hotel again? probably, due only to it's great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location , clean, affordable.”
Reviews.Author: ChrissyTNottingham
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is as close to the colloseum and forum as possible. It is clean and adequately furnished for a short stay in Rome. We had a triple room consisting of a double bed and single which was perfectly adequate for three adults. The bathroom was spotless as was the bedroom and we had fresh towels daily. The ceiling fan worked very well although the air con left a lot to the imagination!! We paid 90 euros a night for the room ( 3 night stay) which for the location was good value. Breakfast is taken outside at the neighbouring cafe and consists of a pastry, crackers and a drinks which is fine for early morning starts when seeing the wonderful sights. We walked to every monument and building not using public transport at all and although this makes for tired legs it is achievable. The Imperiale restaurant next door has another bar/restaurant situated round the corner on the Via Frangipane which we HIGHLY recommend for lunch, dinner and drinks. Fabulous pizzas, pastas and steaks to die for, drinks are well priced,and the staff are very obliging. A relly good meal costs no more than in the UK which for Rome is amazing. We recommend the Romano Hotel and Rome is a wonderful city to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Justjcruzn
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was the perfect location to walk to all of the popular tourist sites. Colosseum and Forum were only a few blocks away. We saw all of the main tourist attractions and did not have to use public transportation, although it was nearby. The room was basic and very clean. It is a small property with very friendly staff. You feel like you are staying with family. The breakfast is very simple, pastry with coffee or juice. It was served in nice outdoor area. Great stay, good price.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location, Friendly, Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TumbleweedandCactus
Reviews.Content: Albergo Romano is a pretty sensational deal, with a fabulous location, really clean rooms, friendly staff and reasonable rates. I wanted to be close to the Colosseum, and I don't think there's a hotel closer. It's close to two metro stations and easy walking distance to the key sights in the central city. This is not a luxury hotel and the rooms are small. I had a single room which was totally sufficient. The bed was comfortable, no noise of any note (and my room faced the street) and staff was helpful and efficient. Breakfast is served in a wonderful outdoor restaurant along the street, with the neighboring coffee shop providing the service. No complaints at all and I would definitely stay there again, especially as a solo traveler.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: FGCESQ
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of my vacation in Italy. The location is absolutely perfect, the breakfast charming, the staff friendly. My only complaint would be the bathroom tiles, which were not clean. Stll, when you consider the location and the modest price of the room, I would overlook the bathroom shortcomings and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: greenpolkadot
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after reading reviews on Tripadvisor, where this hotel was described as a good, cheap and clean place to stay in the centre of Rome. The location was very good, a very short walk from the Foro Romano and the Colosseo. The receptionists were also helpful and friendly. The air condition was a big relief, and worked well. The bathroom was spotlessly clean apart from a few mouldy stains, and it was cleaned daily, which we appreciated very much. The cleaning staff also cleaned the stairs and hallway daily. They were a bit too eager for us, however, when they also tidied up all our things every day by moving them around the room and into the drawers (I would recommend checking all drawers before you leave, to be sure you don't forget anything that the cleaners might have put away). The sheets were also crisp and clean. However, the room itself was NOT clean. There were stripes of grime on the walls and around the switches. The wall paper was torn in several places, giving the room a shabby look. Also, on the negative side, the walls were paper thin, so that when the people in the next room talked and laughed it sounded as if they were in the stairs talking to eachother from one floor to the next. Also, our room one day suddenly smelled of tobacco when we returned in the afternoon, which the receprionist told us probably was from people smoking in the room next door. Bad isolation also meant the cold air leaked out, which meant wasting unnecessary energy when using the air conditioning.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: EgyptianHeidi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Romano during our first night in Rome. It is a very convenient hotel to get to. Like many, we flew into Fiumacino. From there, we took the express train to Rome's Termini station. We were able to walk from Termini station to the Albergo Romano hotel in about 15 minutes. The hotel is PERFECTLY situated across the street from the Forum. It's also just one block from the Colosseum. A great location for seeing Rome. We actually walked all over the city from this little homebase. Our room had large windows and shutters overlooking the street in front as well as the Forum. The room was basic, but clean. The bathroom was basic, but had a nice hot shower and clean linens. The breakfast was lovely, and included a cappucino, glass of juice, warm croissant, and toast with jam. There is also a cafe next door selling gelato and warm paninis that is open late.

Reviews.Title: “Albergo Romano - a little jewel”
Reviews.Author: Lamp2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Albergo Romano for 5 nights after a two week tour in Southern Italy/Sicily. The location was fabulous, just a short walk across the street to the Forum and Colliseum. The hotel is not fancy, the rooms are large, and the breakfast was typical continental style at the cafe next door. Our room was quiet and well insulated. There are restaurants and gelato shops nearby, plus it is within walking distance to most of Rome's treasures. The Metro is a short walk away for visits to the Borguese, Vatican, and main train station. We were very satisfied with the immediate area around the Romano which was safe at night. We will definitely stay here again when we return to Roma. I hate to tell others about this jewel we found in an otherwise very expensive city.

Reviews.Title: “Bargain Room for a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: meanbeam
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week stay at the Hotel Romano. The location is about 2 blocks away from the coluseum and right across the street from Imperial Roman Forum. The rates are very reasonable for this location. It is a typical average European hotel room (maybe a little larger). We had a third floor room with 2 large windows. The street is a busy street however, we found with the windows closed we didnt have any problems with the noise. We couldnt find a better rate for this area. The hotel was clean and our bathroom just had a makeover. The staff is friendly especially Santos. The location and the price make this an incredible find for Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Hosts, Would stay again!!”
Reviews.Author: RomeOrBust
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came across this place when booking our honeymoon... and it was one of the best choices we made. This hotel was GREAT! The location is perfect, directly across the street from the forum. The hotel rooms were clean, workers were nice. We stayed for a week and loved every minute of it. You will not find a nicer hotel for the price and location. You can easily walk to everything resturants, attractions, and train station. When I go back to Italy I will without a doubt be staying here. Don't second guess, just book your room...you will not be disappointed!!!!

Reviews.Title: “great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: polyglot
Reviews.Content: We were in Rome for just two nights and wanted to see the main sights. The location is great for tourists as it's right around the corner from the forum and the Colloseum. Nearly everything else is within walking distance. It's not the most charming neighborhood or hotel, but very practical and a good value in this expensive city. The room was worn, but clean. The bed was comfortable. We had a little balcony. The maids were incredibly neat (would straighten our belongings as well as clean the room). The front staff was extremely helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, suitable room”
Reviews.Author: mcasscanada
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed this hotel. As in all of Italy, it was a noisy room. But the hotel is center to all the action! Right across from the Forum, the Coliseum was a block away, and everything else you would want to see is less than an hours walk! We would start out every day thinking it would take us hours to reach a destination that ended up being less than a few North American sized blocks away. Acton, ON, Canada

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great for families, but noisy”
Reviews.Author: Member17
Reviews.Content: The hotel was able to accommodate our family of four in one room for a reasonable price, fitting in two single beds in addition to a double. The rooms and bathrooms are modern and clean and for a tourist, the location is great: the hotel is right across the street from the Forum and around the corner from the Colosseum. The expression my kids' faces as they turned left and left out of the hotel and saw the Colosseum looming up right in front of them was priceless. The hotel is also right in between two metro stops (Cavour and Colosseo on the Blue Line -- you can get off at either). There is one big disadvantage: the hotel is at the corner of two major streets and the traffic noise goes on all night. While we were there there was also jackhammering on the street in front of the hotel starting at 8 in the morning. Also, the lobby is tiny and there is no breakfast room. We had breakfast in a roped off area on the sidewalk in front of the hotel and I'm not sure what they do in bad weather. (The breakfast is also nothing to write home about -- packaged biscuits and a hard pastry, although the cappuccino that comes with it is delicious.)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel Romano!”
Reviews.Author: Europeantraveler2006
Reviews.Content: Excellent location! Directly between the Collesseum, Forum, and the Piazza Venezia. Easy to catch buses around because you're near almost all the famous landmarks in Rome. The staff is extremely helpful and kind (especially Santo!) Everyone should experience someone like Santo at least once in their lives- he made our stay! Definitely stay at the Hotel Romano if you can...book it well in advance due to limited number of rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Take Your Valuables With You”
Reviews.Author: PomMom
Reviews.Content: Take all your valuables with you when you go out. There's no safe in the room. I'm not going to say any more. Everything the other posters say is accurate: fairly clean (some mold in shower. I reported it and was told it would be cleaned, but 3 days later, the mold was still there) some charm, pretty noisy, great location. Next time we're in Rome, we'll try another place.

Reviews.Title: “ideal location and more”
Reviews.Author: hanid
Reviews.Content: We followed the lead of others at Trip Advisor and stayed at the Hotel Romano for a week in June. It was everything we had been led to believe. Honest, helpful staff and a great location. The neighborhood was lively and fun - we were there during the first week of the World Cup so everyone had Italian soccer fever. The hotel arranged transportation to and from the airport and give us some helpful tips for dining and touring. The rooms are air conditioned and very quiet. This is the ideal hotel for a city - no frills, just a great place to come home to shower and sleep after a long day of touristing about.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: gregcs
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Albergo Romano from June 14th - 19th. As others have said the location is great. Rooms were very clean. I believe I heard a comment from the staff that all rooms are triples, so all will have a double and single bed. The single came in handy for storing our open suitcases. Staff is very friendly and helpful. This is clean, basic accomodation and had more room than I thought it would due to an L-shaped design they use to get the room a window.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and a great value!”
Reviews.Author: gstove
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights in May and we loved it. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the location is great - very close to the Colosseum and the Roman Forum and easy to access all other major sights in Rome. Our room was very clean - the cleaning staff even organized our toiletries for us! We requested a double room, but I think we may have been upgraded as there was also an extra single bed in our room, so plenty of space for the 2 of us to spread out. The bathroom was on the small side (as expected based on past trips to Europe), but not the smallest that we encountered during our stay in Italy. Breakfast was included, but not too exciting. The hotel staff gave us a great recommendation for lunch when we first arrived (Il Ragno D'Oro). Overall, a great value for the price and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Hotel One Block from the Colleseum”
Reviews.Author: simonelegare
Reviews.Content: Okay, it's not fancy, but sometimes you just want an affordable place to stay. Conveniently located just a block from the Colleseum and the Metro, this hotel was recommended to us by some friends who stayed there about a year ago (and he IS Italian). Our room was on the 4th floor (there is a small elevator,thank goodness), and if I craned my neck looking out the bathroom window, I could see the Colleseum. Santo at the front desk was very helpful and friendly and did well at English. He even let us use the computer at the front desk to access the internet. We booked through Venere(-) and paid 150 Euros/night (March 06). Across the street was another fancier hotel (Hotel Forum) and they charge almost twice the price! So Hotel Romano is a pretty good deal. **Alert** Be careful traveling from the Colleseum Metro station to the Termini -- a couple of clean-cut Italian guys (late 20s) tried to steal our bags. Don't let go of your luggage for a second. If we had taken our hands off the handles, the bags would have run out the door. They work in tandem and try to get between you. Stand your ground and yell if you have to. It worked for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and very cheap”
Reviews.Author: Dee27
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really good value - if you want to stay somewhere that is nearby to all the sites then it's ideal. We were only five minutes from the colosseum and 15 minutes from the Trevvi Foundation. We had heard accommodation in Rome was very expensive but this place was really reasonable. Although it is a basic hotel, it was very clean and the staff were very nice - breakfast is included but it's only a coffee and a pastry. Would recommend it as a budget stay

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Little Hotel and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: hcarvell
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Hotel Romano evey year for the last five when in Rome and have always found it to be ideally positioned, comfortable and most of all great value. The friendly service is second to none for the star rating and I have had much better service here than some of the nearby four star hotels. Rooms are simple and clean and breakfast is provided too -perfect to start the day!

Reviews.Title: “What more could you ask for in a hotel???? :)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mum, sister and I stayed at the Romano for two nights in a triple room No.422. It was our 4th time in Rome and had stayed in other hotels but this hotel was real find!! - The rooms are spacious and airy, even in our room with a double and single bed we had loads of room. Marble floors and white walls with red cover sheets on the bed makes the room look very welcoming. - The room we stayed in was totally quiet except for the occasional siren going past but it was still muffled by the sound proof windows. - The brothers who ran the hotel were perfect hosts, so friendly and willing to help. - The bedroom & bathroom were spotless, and i mean SPOTLESS, not a mark, the sheets were crisp and clean and the cleaners changed the sheets and towels everyday. They also folded up your clothes and straightened the room out very nicely. - The newly installed elevator is excellent, especially because we were on the top floor, i wouldn't of fancied climbing the 5 floors with our suitcases! :) - The shower was good and powerful, just the ticket for freshing up after a day's sightseeing, providing piping hot water all day. - The beds were comfortable and the pillows lovely and soft. - The view from our window was beautiful, we looked out on to the roman forum, it was amazing. - The breakfast consisted of cappucino, fruit juice, crossaint, various pastries and toasted bread. The capuccino is gorgeous but the italian bread is quite hard. I cannot but stress the excellent location of this little hotel, situated a few hundred yards from the coloseum and the monumento di emanualle. It is also close to the colosso metro stop. you are right in the heart of it all with every monument in easy walking distance (bring comfy walking shoes). We would definately return to hotel romano and at the moment we are already planning our return!! I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Rome :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: kwt1966
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel!! Wonderful location - right across the street from the Roman Forum and about a two block walk to the coliseum. Smallish rooms, but super clean. The only suggestion I would make is to request a room away from the street. It was kind of noisy there. Otherwise, a great deal for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, but a very basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonTjejen
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent as you can read in many of the other reviews. Right by the Forums and Colosseum. A short cab ride from Termini station. Don't expect any posh hotel. I found it very basic, but the bathroom where clean and the shower was really good. No point even opening the balkony doors, cause it was in a small court yard above the kitchen, so it really smelt. But you have air condition anyway, so it was fine. The breakfast was also quite basic, ( jouice in plastic cups) and it was outside infront of the hotel, not in any roof terasse. But again for the price you pay it is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Best deal in all of Rome!”
Reviews.Author: TonyToronto_Canada
Reviews.Content: My wife and 5 yr old daughter just returned from Italy. We stayed at the Romano for 4 days in a triple room. The room was very spacious and clean. The location of this hotel is excellent. It is a 2 minute walk to the Colloseum. It is located in a small semi-piazza with a snack bar on one side and 2 restaurants (good ones) on the other, on the corner of a major intersection. The location is very easy to find, about a 6 euro taxi ride from Termini Station. Just up the rode is the best Gelateria in Rome and a great grocery store called Elite. The owners of the hotel will assist you with anything. They recommended a good restaurant called Il Ragna del D'Oro. Not only would I stay here again but I would recommend this hotel to anyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location!”
Reviews.Author: tinacan25
Reviews.Content: This hotel has got to be one of the best deals in all of Rome. Walk outside, hang a left, and you're looking at the forum. Round the corner and the Colosseum looms right down the street (also the closest Metro stop). The room was the most spacious I've had in Europe (ok, shaving legs in the shower not the easiest task, yet doable). The staff was friendly, the rooms neat and clean. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Rome on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: fiftyfour
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from Rome where where not even 3 days of constant rain could spoil this amazing city. Round every corner lies something stunning. The hotel Albergo Romano was fantastic, its basic but very clean and the location couldnt be beaten, just a few minutes from the Colusseum. The staff, Santo and Heraldo are incredibly kind and welcoming. The breakfast is coffee, juice, french toast and a pastry which is more than enough for most people. The lift is under construction and looks like it will be soon finished. There are a couple of good restaurants nearby, accross the road is a great Argentian steakhouse, Baises and up the road and down a side steet on the left a great Italian called Wanted. I would definitely return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We definitely found "our" hotel in Rome! Albergo Romano is situated within walking distance to most tourist sites. It is a 5 minute walk to the Colosseum and the Forum. There was one day that all bus drivers were on strike and it was impossible to find public transportation and we were able to walk from the hotel to Vatican City. I would only recommend this if you are in good shape. =) We walked everywhere from this hotel. From Piazza Navona to the Trevi Fountain to the Spanish Steps to Piazza del Popolo. The best way to see Rome is on foot. Make sure you bring comfortable shoes! There are pleny of restaurants and cafes nearby. The restaurant next door is not very good. Also avoid the cafe up Via Cavour with the English speaking lady outside trying to bring all the tourists in the restaurant. They are overpriced and we paid $5 for a can of Coke there. The cafe (where you get your breakfast) right next door is pretty decent and cheap. We stayed here twice and got excellent rooms both times! Both were extremely spacious and clean. Linens were clean and the pillows were actually soft and fluffy! We stayed in 5 different hotels during this trip and this hotel was the only one who had decent pillows! The bathroom was big and spotless with nice towels. The owner, Santo, treated us so well. He gave directions, recommendations, and tips on saving money. Overall, he was an excellent host! We will definitely stay here next time we are in Rome!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel in the heart of a fantastic city”
Reviews.Author: Bluevarlos
Reviews.Content: The Romano is a great little hotel in the heart of ancient Rome. The two brothers who own the hotel were very friendly and welcoming and the service they provided was exceptional. I stayed for a total of 10 nights in a single room which although small was well furnished and clean. The breakfast which was served in the cafe next door was fairly average but the staff, most of whom could speak a few words of English, were very friendly. The hotel is a short walk from both Colosseo and Cavour Metro's and a pleasant 20 minute walk from The Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain and Piazza Navona (my favourite part of The Eternal City). I will definately be returning to the Romano again next year. I would recommend the Romano to anyone who is on the look-out for a cheap, clean and friendly little hotel in the heart of a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Romano in Rome for 4 nights and the location was great - blocks from the Coloseum, Forum and Piazza. The room was big and clean and the staff was friendly and accommodating. It is hard to find and not very big and right now there is no elevator. But the location made up for everything.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from Rome. We stayed two nights at Hotel Romano and had an excellent stay. It is an easy walk from the train station, all of the Rome Sites, and the Vatican. We paid 95 Euros for a great room #105, and was plenty big. The hotel was also VERY clean. As we were leaving one of the guys said they are working on getting an elevator as well as other amenities for the same price. There are great eateries and grocery stores close by. I will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Attentive and Friendly Service at Hotel Romano”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at Romano for a few nights the first time we were in Rome (summer 2000). The gentlemen who ran the hotel then were extremely friendly and (although my review may be a bit dated here it goes... It was very close to the Colisseum and Roman Forum and the subway (Colosseo stop). There are a few eateries, I remember a pizzeria we ran to from the Colisseum during a summer thunderstorm. Even back in 2000, they were pretty technologically advanced - already had their hotel listed online, because that's where my sister found them. When making reservations, they were extremely patient. Upon our arrival and during our stay, if we needed anything, they made sure it was 'fixed' or tended to right away 'subito' -- and they really meant it! I don't remember breakfast being stellar - but it was nice - outdoors. All in all, our stay in Romano was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “geat little hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we were in rome on oct.2004, and used this web site to find our hotels. we found the hotel romano to be what we read on the review. friendly, clean and very well priced. we were very happy with our stay there.
